Node.Name: Science
Node.Description: the intellectual and practical activity encompassing the systematic study of the structure and behaviour of the physical and natural world through observation and experiment.

Node.Name: Computing
Node.Description: the use or operation of computers.

Node.Name: Fuel Efficiency
Node.Description: the capacity of an engine, especially that of a vehicle, to obtain energy from fuel.

Node.Name: Genetics
Node.Description: the study of heredity and the variation of inherited characteristics.

Node.Name: Ecology
Node.Description: the branch of biology that deals with the relations of organisms to one another and to their physical surroundings.

Node.Name: Artificial Intelligence
Node.Description: the theory and development of computer systems able to perform tasks normally requiring human intelligence, such as visual perception, speech recognition, decision-making, and translation between languages.

Node.Name: Communications
Node.Description: means of sending or receiving information, such as telephone lines or computers.

Node.Name: Advanced Rocketry
Node.Description: the branch of science that deals with rockets and rocket propulsion.

Node.Name: Augmentation
Node.Description: the action or process of making or becoming greater in size or amount.

Node.Name: Terraforming
Node.Description: transform (a planet) so as to resemble the earth, especially so that it can support human life.
